summary: influenza virus epidemics result in 3-5 million people and 250,000 to 500,000 deaths worldwide 4. influenza pandemics are caused by the influenza virus, a negative-sense single-stranded member of the Orthomyxoviridae family of RNA viruses 8. influenza pandemics are caused by influenza A viruses. influenza viruses can be classified into 162 subtypes 15. the life cycle of the virus is a complex biological process. a few drugs that function as influenza NA inhibitors are used in clinical. small molecular inhibitors, peptides, proteins, monoclonal antibodies, nanoparticles 30-33 and other types of anti-viral drugs are effective in influenza virus infection. the development of antiviral agents is a practical significance topic that has attracted much attention and had made great progress during the past several decades. combination therapies were also developed 29, 315, 317. treatment with immunomodulatory agents represents a new approach to deal with seasonal and pandemic influenza.
